thread.title: It rained so hard at Disney World, Magic Kingdom actually flooded
thread.title_full: It rained so hard at Disney World, Magic Kingdom actually flooded

author: Rachel Paige
title: It rained so hard at Disney World, Magic Kingdom actually flooded
text:
It rained so hard at Disney World, Magic Kingdom actually flooded Florida is known as the ☀️Sunshine State☀️, but it actually rains there basically every single day of the year. Because, #weather. This is a known fact, and Disney World — situated right in the center of Florida — is prepared to deal with whatever kind of storm might roll through. But sometimes, the clouds approach so fast, and so forcefully, that there’s literally TOO much rain to deal with.
Yesterday, this scenario happened. While the day started off bright and sunny, not one but TWO powerful storms hit Disney World one right after the other, and dropped a whole bunch of rain on the Magic Kingdom . The clouds actually dropped so much rain, that the water couldn’t drain out of the walkways fast enough, and the park actually began to flood. This isn’t a sight you see every day.
Outdoor attractions were closed because of the storm, and guests in the park immediately took shelter indoors (good job, guests!). With nothing left to do but try and wait out the stormy weather, obviously everyone pulled out their phones and started taking pictures of the rising water levels. Seriously, is Magic Kingdom under the sea right now?
What started off as a few lil’ puddles… A post shared by Nano Portillo (@nanoportillo) on Feb 22, 2017 at 1:51pm PST 
A post shared by Taylor Anderson (@tande58) on Feb 22, 2017 at 7:02pm PST 
A post shared by Bonnie Laufer Krebs (@boneb) on Feb 22, 2017 at 1:50pm PST 
…quickly turned into HUGE PUDDLES that guests were literally wading through. A post shared by disney runner (@disneyrun4fun) on Feb 22, 2017 at 2:06pm PST 
A post shared by Mike Gustin (@mike081020) on Feb 22, 2017 at 2:04pm PST 
A post shared by Literary Genius (@literarygenius) on Feb 22, 2017 at 2:35pm PST 
It's a little wet at Magic Kingdom pic.twitter.com/m7dpvT7At8 
— Brent Dodge (@BrentDodge) February 22, 2017 Even after the rain stopped, everything was still very wet. New attraction at Magic Kingdom: pic.twitter.com/zNCXNuKFC7 
— Scott Gustin (@ScottGustin) February 22, 2017 More magical flooding pic.twitter.com/MixuAW0xTV 
— Scott Gustin (@ScottGustin) February 22, 2017 And the rain rain rain came down down down…☔️ A post shared by Raena (@raenamarie_) on Feb 22, 2017 at 8:44pm PST 
A post shared by Carla (@cbassilol) on Feb 22, 2017 at 7:10pm PST 
A post shared by Michelle Rhyne (@whitecanary07) on Feb 22, 2017 at 5:28pm PST 
Even though the rain might not be everyone’s friend for a magical day at MK, it sure does look pretty semi-soaked.
